arm_group.description: Volumes of feed depend on age, weight and appetite.
Volumes of feeds depend on age, weight and appetite

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this clinical study is to show that infants fed a standard starter
      infant formula with 2 Human Milk Oligosaccharides (HMOs) have a growth in line with infants
      fed a standard starter infant formula without HMOs.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Safety of a New Infant Starter Formula Containing 2 Human Milk Oligosaccharides (HMOs)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy babies

          -  Full term babies (37 weeks ≤ gestation ≤ 42 weeks)

          -  birth weight between 2500 g- 4500g

          -  Having obtained the baby's legal representative's informed consent.

          -  FF groups:

        babies aged between birth and 14 days, exclusively formula-fed at time of enrollment,
        whose mother independently elected, before enrollment, not to breastfeed

        • BF group: babies aged 3 months (+/- 5 days), exclusively breastfed since birth.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Congenital illness or malformation that may affect growth

          -  Significant pre-natal and/or serious post-natal disease before enrollment (by medical
             decision)

          -  Minor parent(s)

          -  Newborn whose parents / caregivers cannot be expected to comply with study procedures

          -  Currently participating or having participated in another clinical trial since birth,
             except for BF group, where vaccines studies are allowed.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Safety of a New Infant Starter Formula Containing 2 Human Milk Oligosaccharides (HMOs)

primary_outcome.description: child growth (body weight) from enrollment to 4 months of age

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Parents are asked to complete a diary on digistive tolerance of their child
secondary_outcome.measure: Digestive tolerance (stool charecteristics, bowel movements,behavior patterns)

secondary_outcome.description: Parents are asked to complete a diary on the product compliance
secondary_outcome.measure: Product compliance (quantity of formula in ml consumed on the 3 days before visit)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Treatment
